thread.title: A Pair of U.S. Premieres at Spoleto Festival USA

author: Heidi Waleson
title: A Pair of U.S. Premieres at Spoleto Festival USA
text:
Charleston, S.C.
For those who can’t get enough Donizetti operas, the Spoleto Festival USA, the annual multi-arts extravaganza that runs through June 10, is presenting the U.S. premiere of his “Pia de’ Tolomei” (1837). It’s a musically engaging piece, well worth exhuming, but the misguided production by director Andrea Cigni, which is shared with three Italian opera houses, did it no favors.
